detailsOfAchievement: Residents Awareness Association of Coimbatore is a voluntary service organization, with the vision of raising the awareness and initiating action for economic and environmentally sustainable development of Coimbatore. RAAC has been formed to express the concerns of the citizens in Coimbatore and to bring to focus the need for taking suitable steps to ensure the city and its surrounding areas are able to meet the future with confidence. RAAC activities mainly focus on three areas namely, Urban Infra Structure, Solid Waste Management and Environment Protection. The main objectives of RAAC is 1. To Develop the city of coimbatore particularly residential layouts 2. To emphasize and popularize the concept of sustainable development and to oppose all lopsided and resource debilitating developments within the city of Coimbatore. 3. To promote cooperation friendships peaceful living and understanding amongst the owners of independent houses in city of coimbatore 4. To manage, maintain, protect, take care of and improve the common amenities properties , roads, sites, gardens, play grounds, libraries, community halls, electric facilities, water connection , sewage connection, drainage, and such other common properties, things or rights already owned, existing or those which may be created , acquired, owned or obtained in future for the benefits, and/or advantage of all the members of the association 5. To preserve and improve the hygiene and eco friendly atmosphere of the city of coimbatore and its surroundings 6. To serve the weaker section of the society and aid to uplift their society and economic wellbeing 7. To promote fraternity, unity, integrity, patriotism and sectional tolerance and to celebrate national events and festivals involving people from all sections of society irrespective of caste, creed, culture or religion 8. To aid and serve all those in any part of the globe who are affected by natural calamities such as tsunami, cyclone, flood, earthquake, and the like 9. To facilitate an effective system / schemes for garbage disposal, vehicle parking system and security arrangement in the specific localities of the member of the association. OUR CURRENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDES, 1. Awareness and implementation of systematic Solid Waste Management in residential apartments and public communities in partnership with Coimbatore City Municipal Corporation and No Dumping: My Waste My responsibility. 2. Active Participation in Swachh Bharat Urban in partnership of Coimbatore City Municipal Corporation through awareness programs, documentations and organization of mass thematic cleaning programs in public places. 3. Active participation in advisory board of Coimbatore Smart city Limited in the verticals of lakes & water bodies and Model Road through systematic studies on lakes and roads. 4. Development and Maintenance of Urban forests, Recreational Parks, walkerâ€™s parks and children park in partnership with Robert Bosch CSR initiatives. 5. Development & implementation of Digital class room in government school in Gandhimanagar, Coimbatore. 6. Promotion and implementation of household Green Digester Covai Composter to motivate residents to compost green kitchen waste in their home (onsite composting) in partnership with Ideal Ploy Technologies Pvt Ltd.

Through this Adolescent girls and women now they are take initiate share any problems and issue in the Internal Complaints Committee meeting, now reduce issues and problems inside mill hostels and working place. Therefore 3000 Adolescent girls and women are directly benefitted. â€¢ 168 Sumangali victims they got tailoring training in last three years, All of them applied free tailoring Machine from the Government, some of the people bring the tailoring machine and doing tailoring in their home, through this per day Rs.200/- earned, some of the victims joined nearby local garment factories. â€¢ 118 Sumangali victims they got computer training in last three years, After the completion of Computer training all of them joined in different kinds of institutions like Grocery shop, fuel stations, Departmental Stores, Computer Centers, Browsing Centers, etcâ€¦ â€¢ READ initiated Sanitary Napkin Unit called â€œHappyâ€. We form the Self Help Group (SHG), this Group have 12 Members, among them 7 members (Ex Textile Workers) are working in the Sanitary Napkin Unit. Per week around 200 â€“ 300 packets are produced, READ only monitoring, Facilitating and marketing linking roles only made. Through this we help improve the health and hygienic condition to Rural Adolescent girls, Women and Textile Workers. 41 Tribal villages Conducted medical Camps through Mobile Medical Unit run by Tamilnadu Government

detailsOfAchievement: RMD PAIN AND PALLIATIVE CARE TRUST (RMD), a registered Charitable Trust established in the year July 2005 are distinguished in the market as a system provider of pain and palliative hospice services to the terminally ill in Tamil Nadu. The vision is to provide individualized care through outpatient, inpatient, home based and hospital Care. The growing need and a mission to expand the reach of palliative care services paved the way to form a trust in the year 2005. Since then the trust has been providing health awareness for the general public, training and education for nurses, psychosocial workers and caregivers.
